Posts.Content: cuddyclothes wrote: I was told by another BC survivor that a MRI core biopsy hurts so much because of the radioactive dye that I should be sedated or given a really powerful painkiller. Who has had this experience? I've had a diagnostic mammogram on my right breast after an MRI found something. I had BC last year in my left breast. Dx 6/30/2015, IDC: Papillary, Left, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 7/22/2015 Lumpectomy; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Radiation Therapy 11/11/2015 Dx 6/5/2016, LCIS, Right, <1cm Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does an MRI core biopsy hurt? cuddyclothes cuddyclothes
